The content inside the popover.

destroyEndButton.!description: Destroys the endButton in the aggregation {@link #getEndButton endButton}.

parameters.oSubHeader: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The subHeader to set

sap.m.Popover.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Popover. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPlacement placement} : sap.m.PlacementType (default: Right)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getModal modal} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getOffsetX offsetX} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getOffsetY offsetY} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowArrow showArrow} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getContentWidth contentWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getContentMinWidth contentMinWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: )
    • {@link #getContentHeight contentHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getEnableScrolling enableScrolling} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVerticalScrolling verticalScrolling} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBounce bounce} : boolean
    • {@link #getResizable resizable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getCustomHeader customHeader} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getSubHeader subHeader} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getFooter footer} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getBeginButton beginButton} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getEndButton endButton} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Associations
    • {@link #getLeftButton leftButton} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Button)
    • {@link #getRightButton rightButton} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Button)
    • {@link #getInitialFocus initialFocus} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:afterOpen afterOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterClose afterClose} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeOpen beforeOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeClose beforeClose} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.oCustomHeader: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The customHeader to set

setContentHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getContentHeight contentHeight}. Set the height of the content area inside Popover. When controls which adapt their size to the parent control are added directly into Popover, for example sap.m.Page control, a size needs to be specified to the content area of the Popover. Otherwise, Popover control isn't able to display the content in the right way. This values isn't necessary for controls added to Popover directly which can decide their size by themselves, for exmaple sap.m.List, sap.m.Image etc., only needed for controls that adapt their size to the parent control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sContentHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property contentHeight

getContentWidth.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getContentWidth contentWidth}.

Set the width of the content area inside Popover. When controls which adapt their size to the parent control are added directly into Popover, for example sap.m.Page control, a size needs to be specified to the content area of the Popover. Otherwise, Popover control isn't able to display the content in the right way. This values isn't necessary for controls added to Popover directly which can decide their size by themselves, for exmaple sap.m.List, sap.m.Image etc., only needed for controls that adapt their size to the parent control.

outerWidth.!description: Calculate outerWidth of the element; used as hook for SVG elements

parameters.oElement: type: HTMLElement, description: An Element for which outerWidth will be calculated.
parameters.bIncludeMargin: type: boolean, description: Determines if the margins should be included in the calculated outerWidth. Default value is false.

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

setTitle.!description:
The setter of the title property.

If you want to show a header in the popover, don't forget to set the {@link #setShowHeader showHeader} property to true.

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: The title to be set

destroySubHeader.!description: Destroys the subHeader in the aggregation {@link #getSubHeader subHeader}.

fireAfterClose.!description: Fires event {@link #event:afterClose afterClose} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setOffsetY.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOffsetY offsetY}. The offset for the popover placement in the y axis. It's with unit pixel. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.iOffsetY: type: int, description: New value for property offsetY

setHorizontalScrolling.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling}. This property indicates if user can scroll horizontally inside popover when the content is bigger than the content area. However, when scrollable control (sap.m.ScrollContainer, sap.m.Page) is in the popover, this property needs to be set to false to disable the scrolling in popover in order to make the scrolling in the child control work properly. Popover detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, or sap.m.ScrollContainer as direct child added to Popover. If there is, Popover will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bHorizontalScrolling: type: boolean, description: New value for property horizontalScrolling

setOffsetX.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOffsetX offsetX}. The offset for the popover placement in the x axis. It's with unit pixel. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.iOffsetX: type: int, description: New value for property offsetX

setContentWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getContentWidth contentWidth}. Set the width of the content area inside Popover. When controls which adapt their size to the parent control are added directly into Popover, for example sap.m.Page control, a size needs to be specified to the content area of the Popover. Otherwise, Popover control isn't able to display the content in the right way. This values isn't necessary for controls added to Popover directly which can decide their size by themselves, for exmaple sap.m.List, sap.m.Image etc., only needed for controls that adapt their size to the parent control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sContentWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property contentWidth

attachAfterOpen.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:afterOpen afterOpen} event of this sap.m.Popover. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.Popover itself. This event will be fired after the popover is opened.
attachAfterOpen.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.Popover

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.Popover itself

sap.m.Popover.!helpDescription:
Displays additional information for an object in a compact way.

Overview

The popover displays additional information for an object in a compact way and without leaving the page. The popover can contain various UI elements such as fields, tables, images, and charts. It can also include actions in the footer.

Structure

The popover has three main areas:
  • Header (optional) - with a back button and a title
  • Content - holds all the controls
  • Footer (optional) - with additional action buttons

Guidelines

  • Do not overlap popovers.
  • You can determine the {@link sap.m.PlacementType placement} of the popover relative to the control that opens it.
  • Ensure that the content has a basic design and shows only the most important information.

Usage

When to use:

  • You need to define your own structure of controls within the popover.

When not to use:

  • The {@link sap.m.QuickView QuickView} is more appropriate for your use case.

Responsive Behavior

The popover is closed when the user clicks or taps outside the popover or selects an action within the popover. You can prevent this with the modal property. The popover can be resized when the resizable property is enabled.
  • {@link sap.m.Popover} is not responsive on mobile devices - it will always be rendered as a popover and you have to take care of its size and position.
  • {@link sap.m.ResponsivePopover} is adaptive and responsive. It renders as a dialog with a close button in the header on phones, and as a popover on tablets.

attachBeforeOpen.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:beforeOpen beforeOpen} event of this sap.m.Popover. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.Popover itself. This event will be fired before the popover is opened.
attachBeforeOpen.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.Popover

sap.m.Popover.!description:
Displays additional information for an object in a compact way.

Overview

The popover displays additional information for an object in a compact way and without leaving the page. The popover can contain various UI elements such as fields, tables, images, and charts. It can also include actions in the footer.

Structure

The popover has three main areas:
  • Header (optional) - with a back button and a title
  • Content - holds all the controls
  • Footer (optional) - with additional action buttons

Guidelines

  • Do not overlap popovers.
  • You can determine the {@link sap.m.PlacementType placement} of the popover relative to the control that opens it.
  • Ensure that the content has a basic design and shows only the most important information.

Usage

When to use:

  • You need to define your own structure of controls within the popover.

When not to use:

  • The {@link sap.m.QuickView QuickView} is more appropriate for your use case.

Responsive Behavior

The popover is closed when the user clicks or taps outside the popover or selects an action within the popover. You can prevent this with the modal property. The popover can be resized when the resizable property is enabled.
  • {@link sap.m.Popover} is not responsive on mobile devices - it will always be rendered as a popover and you have to take care of its size and position.
  • {@link sap.m.ResponsivePopover} is adaptive and responsive. It renders as a dialog with a close button in the header on phones, and as a popover on tablets.

parameters.bResizable: type: boolean, description: New value for property resizable

fireAfterOpen.!description: Fires event {@link #event:afterOpen afterOpen} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

removeAllAriaDescribedBy.!description: Removes all the controls in the association named {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy}.

getHorizontalScrolling.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling}. This property indicates if user can scroll horizontally inside popover when the content is bigger than the content area. However, when scrollable control (sap.m.ScrollContainer, sap.m.Page) is in the popover, this property needs to be set to false to disable the scrolling in popover in order to make the scrolling in the child control work properly. Popover detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, or sap.m.ScrollContainer as direct child added to Popover. If there is, Popover will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property. Default value is true.

getBeginButton.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getBeginButton beginButton}.

BeginButton is shown at the left side (right side in RTL mode) inside the header. When showHeader is set to false, the property is ignored.

SingleSelect.!description: Right-positioned single selection mode (only one list item can be selected).

Right.!description: Popover will be placed at the right side of the reference control.

VerticalPreferredTop.!description: Popover will be placed at the top or bottom of the reference control but will try to position on the top side if the space is greater than the Popover's height.

Top.!description: Popover will be placed at the top of the reference control.

VerticalPreferedTop.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.36 Instead, use sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredTop type.
Deprecated - use sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredTop type.

PreferredBottomOrFlip.!description: Popover will be placed to the bottom of the reference control. If the available space is less than the Popover's height, it will appear to the top of the same reference control bottom border.

HorizontalPreferedLeft.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.36 Instead, use sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredLeft type.
Deprecated - use sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredLeft type.

HorizontalPreferredLeft.!description: Popover will be placed at the right or left side of the reference control but will try to position on the left side if the space is greater than the Popover's width.

Left.!description: Popover will be placed at the left side of the reference control.

PreferredRightOrFlip.!description: Popover will be placed to the right of the reference control. If the available space is less than the Popover's width, it will appear to the left of the same reference control right border.

PreferredLeftOrFlip.!description: Popover will be placed to the left of the reference control. If the available space is less than the Popover's width, it will appear to the right of the same reference control left border.

Bottom.!description: Popover will be placed at the bottom of the reference control.

sap.m.PlacementType.!description: Types for the placement of Popover control.

Vertical.!description: Popover will be placed at the top or bottom of the reference control.

VerticalPreferedBottom.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.36 Instead, use sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredBottom type.
Deprecated - use sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredBottom type.

Auto.!description: Popover will be placed automatically at the reference control.

Horizontal.!description: Popover will be placed at the right or left side of the reference control.

HorizontalPreferredRight.!description: Popover will be placed at the right or left side of the reference control but will try to position on the right side if the space is greater than the Popover's width.

VerticalPreferredBottom.!description: Popover will be placed at the top or bottom of the reference control but will try to position on the bottom side if the space is greater than the Popover's height.

HorizontalPreferedRight.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.36 Instead, use sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredRight type.
Deprecated - use sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredRight type.

PreferredTopOrFlip.!description: Popover will be placed to the top of the reference control. If the available space is less than the Popover's height, it will appear to the bottom of the same reference control top border.

setSticky.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSticky sticky}. Defines the section of the sap.m.Table control that remains fixed at the top of the page during vertical scrolling as long as the table is in the viewport. Note: There is limited browser support, hence the API is in experimental state. Browsers that currently support this feature are Chrome (desktop and mobile), Safari (desktop and mobile) and Edge 41. There are also some known issues with respect to the scrolling behavior and focus handling. A few are given below: If the table is placed in certain layout containers, for example, the sap.ui.layout.Grid control, the column headers are not fixed at the top of the viewport. Similar behavior is also observed with the sap.m.ObjectPage control. This API should not be used in a productive environment. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is None.

parameters.sSticky: type: sap.m.Sticky, description: New value for property sticky

setPopinLayout.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPopinLayout popinLayout}. Defines the layout in which the table pop-in rows are rendered. Note: The demandPopin and minScreenWidth properties of the Column control must be configured appropriately. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Block.

parameters.bShowOverlay: type: boolean, description: New value for property showOverlay

sap.m.Table.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Table. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign} : sap.m.BackgroundDesign (default: Translucent)
    • {@link #getFixedLayout fixedLayout} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowOverlay showOverlay} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAlternateRowColors alternateRowColors} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPopinLayout popinLayout} : sap.m.PopinLayout (default: Block)
    • {@link #getSticky sticky} : sap.m.Sticky (default: None)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : sap.m.Column[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:beforeOpenContextMenu beforeOpenContextMenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ListBase#constructor sap.m.ListBase} can be used as well.

indexOfColumn.!description: Checks for the provided sap.m.Column in the aggregation {@link #getColumns columns}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oColumn: type: sap.m.Column, description: The column whose index is looked for

sap.m.Table.!description: sap.m.Table control provides a set of sophisticated and convenience functions for responsive table design. To render the sap.m.Table properly, the order of the columns aggregation should match with the order of the items cells aggregation. Also sap.m.Table requires at least one visible sap.m.Column in columns aggregation. For mobile devices, the recommended limit of table rows is 100 (based on 4 columns) to assure proper performance. To improve initial rendering on large tables, use the growing feature. See section "{@link topic:5eb6f63e0cc547d0bdc934d3652fdc9b Creating Tables}" and "{@link topic:38855e06486f4910bfa6f4485f7c2bac Configuring Responsive Behavior of a Table}" in the documentation for an introduction to sap.m.Table control.

getFixedLayout.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFixedLayout fixedLayout}. Defines the algorithm to be used to layout the table cells, rows, and columns. By default, a table is rendered with fixed layout algorithm. This means the horizontal layout only depends on the table's width and the width of the columns, not the contents of the cells. Cells in subsequent rows do not affect column widths. This allows a browser to layout the table faster than the auto table layout since the browser can begin to display the table once the first row has been analyzed. When this property is set to false, sap.m.Table is rendered with auto layout algorithm. This means, the width of the table and its cells depends on the contents of the cells. The column width is set by the widest unbreakable content inside the cells. This can make the rendering slow, since the browser needs to read through all the content in the table before determining the final layout. Note: Since sap.m.Table does not have its own scrollbars, setting fixedLayout to false can force the table to overflow, which may cause visual problems. It is suggested to use this property when a table has a few columns in wide screens or within the horizontal scroll container (e.g sap.m.Dialog) to handle overflow. In auto layout mode the width property of sap.m.Column is taken into account as a minimum width. Default value is true.

addColumn.!description: Adds some column to the aggregation {@link #getColumns columns}.

parameters.oColumn: type: sap.m.Column, description: The column to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

insertColumn.!description: Inserts a column into the aggregation {@link #getColumns columns}.

parameters.oColumn: type: sap.m.Column, description: The column to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the column should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the column is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the column is inserted at the last position

Note: This property can only be used with the Belize and Belize Deep themes. Alternate row coloring is not available for the High Contrast Black/White themes. Default value is false.

setFixedLayout.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFixedLayout fixedLayout}. Defines the algorithm to be used to layout the table cells, rows, and columns. By default, a table is rendered with fixed layout algorithm. This means the horizontal layout only depends on the table's width and the width of the columns, not the contents of the cells. Cells in subsequent rows do not affect column widths. This allows a browser to layout the table faster than the auto table layout since the browser can begin to display the table once the first row has been analyzed. When this property is set to false, sap.m.Table is rendered with auto layout algorithm. This means, the width of the table and its cells depends on the contents of the cells. The column width is set by the widest unbreakable content inside the cells. This can make the rendering slow, since the browser needs to read through all the content in the table before determining the final layout. Note: Since sap.m.Table does not have its own scrollbars, setting fixedLayout to false can force the table to overflow, which may cause visual problems. It is suggested to use this property when a table has a few columns in wide screens or within the horizontal scroll container (e.g sap.m.Dialog) to handle overflow. In auto layout mode the width property of sap.m.Column is taken into account as a minimum width. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bFixedLayout: type: boolean, description: New value for property fixedLayout

getBackgroundDesign.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign}. Sets the background style of the table. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background from Solid to Translucent or to Transparent. Default value is Translucent.

sap.m.Table.!helpDescription: sap.m.Table control provides a set of sophisticated and convenience functions for responsive table design. To render the sap.m.Table properly, the order of the columns aggregation should match with the order of the items cells aggregation. Also sap.m.Table requires at least one visible sap.m.Column in columns aggregation. For mobile devices, the recommended limit of table rows is 100 (based on 4 columns) to assure proper performance. To improve initial rendering on large tables, use the growing feature. See section "{@link topic:5eb6f63e0cc547d0bdc934d3652fdc9b Creating Tables}" and "{@link topic:38855e06486f4910bfa6f4485f7c2bac Configuring Responsive Behavior of a Table}" in the documentation for an introduction to sap.m.Table control.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.Table.

getSticky.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSticky sticky}. Defines the section of the sap.m.Table control that remains fixed at the top of the page during vertical scrolling as long as the table is in the viewport. Note: There is limited browser support, hence the API is in experimental state. Browsers that currently support this feature are Chrome (desktop and mobile), Safari (desktop and mobile) and Edge 41. There are also some known issues with respect to the scrolling behavior and focus handling. A few are given below: If the table is placed in certain layout containers, for example, the sap.ui.layout.Grid control, the column headers are not fixed at the top of the viewport. Similar behavior is also observed with the sap.m.ObjectPage control. This API should not be used in a productive environment. Default value is None.

sap.m.semantic.SemanticPage.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SemanticPage. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getTitleLevel titleLevel} : sap.ui.core.TitleLevel (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getShowNavButton showNavButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSubHeader showSubHeader} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableScrolling enableScrolling} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFooter showFooter} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFloatingFooter floatingFooter} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSemanticRuleSet semanticRuleSet} : sap.m.semantic.SemanticRuleSetType (default: Classic)
    • {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign} : sap.m.PageBackgroundDesign (default: Standard)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSubHeader subHeader} : sap.m.IBar
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getCustomHeaderContent customHeaderContent} : sap.m.Button[]
    • {@link #getCustomFooterContent customFooterContent} : sap.m.Button[]
    • {@link #getLandmarkInfo landmarkInfo} : sap.m.PageAccessibleLandmarkInfo
  • Events
    • {@link #event:navButtonPress navButtonPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: New value for property title

destroySubHeader.!description: Destroys the subHeader in the aggregation {@link #getSubHeader subHeader}.

removeAllCustomHeaderContent.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getCustomHeaderContent customHeaderContent}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

sap.m.semantic.SemanticPage.!helpDescription:
An enhanced {@link sap.m.Page}, that can contain controls with semantic meaning, see {@link sap.m.semantic.SemanticControl}. Note: This control implements the SAP Fiori 1.0 design guidelines. For SAP Fiori 2.0, see the {@link sap.f.semantic.SemanticPage}.

Overview

The main functionality of the SemanticPage is to predefine the placement, behavior and styles of the page elements. Content specified in the semantic aggregations will be automatically positioned in dedicated sections of the footer or the header of the page.

Structure

The semantics of the content are the following:
  • Visual properties (for example, AddAction will be styled as an icon button)
  • Position in the page (UX guidelines specify that some buttons should be in the header only, while others are in the footer or the "share" menu, so we do the correct positioning)
  • Sequence order (UX guidelines define a specific sequence order of semantic controls with respect to each other)
  • Default localized tooltip for icon-only buttons
  • Overflow behavior (UX guidelines define which buttons are allowed to go to the overflow of the toolbar when the screen gets narrower). For icon buttons, we ensure that the text label of the button appears when the button is in overflow, as specified by UX.
  • Screen reader support (invisible text for reading the semantic type)
In addition to the predefined semantic controls, the SemanticPage can host also custom app controls. It preserves most of the API of the {@link sap.m.Page} for specifying page content.

Usage

The app developer only has to specify the action type, and the required styling and positioning are automatically added.

By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server. If bandwidth is key for the application, set this value to false. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bIconDensityAware: type: boolean, description: New value for property iconDensityAware

addAriaDescribedBy.!description: Adds some ariaDescribedBy into the association {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy}.

getIconDensityAware.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware}. By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server. If bandwidth is key for the application, set this value to false. Default value is true.

sap.m.StandardTile.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new StandardTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getInfo info} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getActiveIcon activeIcon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getNumber number} : string
    • {@link #getNumberUnit numberUnit} : string
    • {@link #getInfoState infoState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.m.StandardTileType (default: None)
    • {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware} : boolean (default: true)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Tile#constructor sap.m.Tile} can be used as well.

parameters.sInfo: type: string, description: New value for property info

Constructor for a new SuggestionItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

    • {@link #getDescription description} : string (default: )
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Item#constructor sap.ui.core.Item} can be used as well.

getIcon.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIcon icon}. The icon belonging to this list item instance. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI. Default value is empty string.

render.!description:
Produces the HTML of the suggestion item and writes it to render-output-buffer.

Subclasses may override this function.
render.!type: fn(oRenderManager: sap.ui.core.RenderManager, oItem: sap.m.SuggestionItem, sSearch: String, bSelected: Boolean)

parameters.bSelected: type: boolean, description: The item is selected
parameters.sSearch: type: string, description: The search text that should be emphasized
parameters.oItem: type: sap.m.SuggestionItem, description: The item which should be rendered

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

parameters.sDescription: type: string, description: New value for property description

setIcon.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIcon icon}. The icon belonging to this list item instance. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

parameters.sIcon: type: string, description: New value for property icon

getSuggestionText.!description: Return suggestion text. By default, it is the value of the text property. Subclasses may override this function.

Defines whether the overflow area is automatically closed when interacting with a control in it When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bCloseOverflowOnInteraction: type: boolean, description: New value for property closeOverflowOnInteraction

setStayInOverflow.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.32 undefined
Sets a new value for property {@link #getStayInOverflow stayInOverflow}. The OverflowToolbar item can or cannot stay in the overflow area When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bStayInOverflow: type: boolean, description: New value for property stayInOverflow

sap.m.OverflowToolbarLayoutData.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new OverflowToolbarLayoutData. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getMoveToOverflow moveToOverflow} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getStayInOverflow stayInOverflow} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPriority priority} : sap.m.OverflowToolbarPriority (default: High)
    • {@link #getGroup group} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getCloseOverflowOnInteraction closeOverflowOnInteraction} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ToolbarLayoutData#constructor sap.m.ToolbarLayoutData} can be used as well.

getMoveToOverflow.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.32 undefined
Gets current value of property {@link #getMoveToOverflow moveToOverflow}. The OverflowToolbar item can or cannot move to the overflow area Default value is true.

setGroup.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getGroup group}. Defines OverflowToolbar items group number. Default value is 0, which means that the control does not belong to any group. Elements that belong to a group overflow together. The overall priority of the group is defined by the element with highest priority. Elements that belong to a group are not allowed to have AlwaysOverflow or NeverOverflow priority. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.iGroup: type: int, description: New value for property group

getCloseOverflowOnInteraction.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getCloseOverflowOnInteraction closeOverflowOnInteraction}. Defines whether the overflow area is automatically closed when interacting with a control in it Default value is true.

sap.m.OverflowToolbarLayoutData.!description: Holds layout data for the {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar} items.

setMoveToOverflow.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.32 undefined
Sets a new value for property {@link #getMoveToOverflow moveToOverflow}. The OverflowToolbar item can or cannot move to the overflow area When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bMoveToOverflow: type: boolean, description: New value for property moveToOverflow

getPriority.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPriority priority}. Defines OverflowToolbar items priority, Available priorities ate NeverOverflow, High, Low, Disappear and AlwaysOverflow Default value is High.

getGroup.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGroup group}. Defines OverflowToolbar items group number. Default value is 0, which means that the control does not belong to any group. Elements that belong to a group overflow together. The overall priority of the group is defined by the element with highest priority. Elements that belong to a group are not allowed to have AlwaysOverflow or NeverOverflow priority. Default value is 0.

setPriority.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPriority priority}. Defines OverflowToolbar items priority, Available priorities ate NeverOverflow, High, Low, Disappear and AlwaysOverflow When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is High.

parameters.sPriority: type: sap.m.OverflowToolbarPriority, description: New value for property priority

getStayInOverflow.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.32 undefined
Gets current value of property {@link #getStayInOverflow stayInOverflow}. The OverflowToolbar item can or cannot stay in the overflow area Default value is false.

sap.m.OverflowToolbarLayoutData.!helpDescription: Holds layout data for the {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar} items.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.OverflowToolbarLayoutData.

getShowLogout.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowLogout showLogout}. Determines whether the Logout button should be displayed. Currently, this only happens on very tall screens (1568px height), otherwise, it is always hidden. Default value is true.

setLogo.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getLogo logo}. Defines the logo to be displayed next to the App when the screen is sufficiently large. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sLogo: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property logo

setTitleLevel.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTitleLevel titleLevel}. Defines the semantic level of the title. This information is used by assistive technologies, such as screen readers to create a hierarchical site map for faster navigation. Depending on this setting an HTML h1-h6 element is used. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is H1.

parameters.sTitleLevel: type: sap.ui.core.TitleLevel, description: New value for property titleLevel

setHomeIcon.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHomeIcon homeIcon}. Sets the icon used for the mobile device home screen and the icon to be used for bookmarks by desktop browsers. This property should be only set once, and as early as possible. Subsequent calls replace the previous icon settings and may lead to different behavior depending on the browser. Different image sizes for device home screen need to be given as PNG images, an ICO file needs to be given as desktop browser bookmark icon (other file formats may not work in all browsers). The precomposed flag defines whether there is already a glow effect contained in the home screen images (or whether iOS should add such an effect). The given structure could look like this: { 'phone':'phone-icon_57x57.png', 'phone@2':'phone-retina_114x114.png', 'tablet':'tablet-icon_72x72.png', 'tablet@2':'tablet-retina_144x144.png', 'precomposed':true, 'favicon':'favicon.ico' } See jQuery.sap.setIcons() for full documentation. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.oHomeIcon: type: object, description: New value for property homeIcon

getBackgroundOpacity.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundOpacity backgroundOpacity}. Defines the opacity of the background image. The opacity can be set between 0 (fully transparent) and 1 (fully opaque). This can be used to improve readability of the Shell content by making the background image partly transparent. Default value is 1.

setHeaderRightText.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeaderRightText headerRightText}. Defines texts, such as the name of the logged-in user, which should be displayed on the right side of the header (if there is enough space to display the header at all - this only happens on very tall screens (1568px height), otherwise, it is always hidden). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHeaderRightText: type: string, description: New value for property headerRightText

getBackgroundColor.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundColor backgroundColor}.

Defines the background color of the Shell. If set, this color will override the default background defined by the theme. This should only be set when really required. Any configured background image will be placed above this colored background. Use the backgroundRepeat property to define whether this image should be stretched to cover the complete Shell or whether it should be tiled.

parameters.oApp: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The app to set

getAppWidthLimited.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAppWidthLimited appWidthLimited}. Determines whether the width of the content (the aggregated App) should be limited or extended to the full screen width. Default value is true.

getBackgroundImage.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundImage backgroundImage}.

Defines the background image of the Shell. If set, this image will override the default background defined by the theme. This should only be set when really required. This background image will be placed above any color set for the background. Use the backgroundRepeat property to define whether this image should be stretched to cover the complete Shell or whether it should be tiled.

getApp.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getApp app}.

A Shell contains an App or a SplitApp (they may be wrapped in a View). Other control types are not allowed.

setAppWidthLimited.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAppWidthLimited appWidthLimited}. Determines whether the width of the content (the aggregated App) should be limited or extended to the full screen width. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bAppWidthLimited: type: boolean, description: New value for property appWidthLimited

setShowLogout.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowLogout showLogout}. Determines whether the Logout button should be displayed. Currently, this only happens on very tall screens (1568px height), otherwise, it is always hidden. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowLogout: type: boolean, description: New value for property showLogout

getLogo.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getLogo logo}.

Defines the logo to be displayed next to the App when the screen is sufficiently large.

setBackgroundRepeat.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBackgroundRepeat backgroundRepeat}. Determines whether the background image (if configured) should be proportionally stretched to cover the whole Shell (false, default) or whether it should be tiled (true). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bBackgroundRepeat: type: boolean, description: New value for property backgroundRepeat

destroyApp.!description: Destroys the app in the aggregation {@link #getApp app}.

getTitle.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getTitle title}.

Defines the application title, which may or may not be displayed outside the actual application, depending on the available screen size.

detachLogout.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:logout logout} event of this sap.m.Shell. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

getHeaderRightText.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeaderRightText headerRightText}.

Defines texts, such as the name of the logged-in user, which should be displayed on the right side of the header (if there is enough space to display the header at all - this only happens on very tall screens (1568px height), otherwise, it is always hidden).

setBackgroundImage.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBackgroundImage backgroundImage}. Defines the background image of the Shell. If set, this image will override the default background defined by the theme. This should only be set when really required. This background image will be placed above any color set for the background. Use the backgroundRepeat property to define whether this image should be stretched to cover the complete Shell or whether it should be tiled. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sBackgroundImage: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property backgroundImage

fireLogout.!description: Fires event {@link #event:logout logout} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setBackgroundOpacity.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBackgroundOpacity backgroundOpacity}. Defines the opacity of the background image. The opacity can be set between 0 (fully transparent) and 1 (fully opaque). This can be used to improve readability of the Shell content by making the background image partly transparent. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

parameters.fBackgroundOpacity: type: float, description: New value for property backgroundOpacity

If set, this color will override the default background defined by the theme. This should only be set when really required. Any configured background image will be placed above this colored background. Use the backgroundRepeat property to define whether this image should be stretched to cover the complete Shell or whether it should be tiled. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

sap.m.Shell.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Shell. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getLogo logo} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getShowLogout showLogout} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeaderRightText headerRightText} : string
    • {@link #getAppWidthLimited appWidthLimited} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBackgroundColor backgroundColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor
    • {@link #getBackgroundImage backgroundImage} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getBackgroundRepeat backgroundRepeat} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getBackgroundOpacity backgroundOpacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getHomeIcon homeIcon} : object
    • {@link #getTitleLevel titleLevel} : sap.ui.core.TitleLevel (default: H1)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getApp app} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:logout logout} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getTitleLevel.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTitleLevel titleLevel}. Defines the semantic level of the title. This information is used by assistive technologies, such as screen readers to create a hierarchical site map for faster navigation. Depending on this setting an HTML h1-h6 element is used. Default value is H1.

getBackgroundRepeat.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundRepeat backgroundRepeat}. Determines whether the background image (if configured) should be proportionally stretched to cover the whole Shell (false, default) or whether it should be tiled (true). Default value is false.

getHomeIcon.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHomeIcon homeIcon}. Sets the icon used for the mobile device home screen and the icon to be used for bookmarks by desktop browsers. This property should be only set once, and as early as possible. Subsequent calls replace the previous icon settings and may lead to different behavior depending on the browser. Different image sizes for device home screen need to be given as PNG images, an ICO file needs to be given as desktop browser bookmark icon (other file formats may not work in all browsers). The precomposed flag defines whether there is already a glow effect contained in the home screen images (or whether iOS should add such an effect). The given structure could look like this: { 'phone':'phone-icon_57x57.png', 'phone@2':'phone-retina_114x114.png', 'tablet':'tablet-icon_72x72.png', 'tablet@2':'tablet-retina_144x144.png', 'precomposed':true, 'favicon':'favicon.ico' } See jQuery.sap.setIcons() for full documentation.

sap.m.Shell.!description: The Shell control can be used as root element of applications. It can contain an App or a SplitApp control. The Shell provides some overarching functionality for the overall application and takes care of visual adaptation, such as a frame around the App, on desktop browser platforms.

attachLogout.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:logout logout} event of this sap.m.Shell. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.Shell itself. Fires when the user presses the logout button/link.
attachLogout.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.Shell

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.Shell itself

setTitle.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTitle title}. Defines the application title, which may or may not be displayed outside the actual application, depending on the available screen size. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: New value for property title

sap.m.Shell.!helpDescription: The Shell control can be used as root element of applications. It can contain an App or a SplitApp control. The Shell provides some overarching functionality for the overall application and takes care of visual adaptation, such as a frame around the App, on desktop browser platforms.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.Shell.

SubHeader.!description: The bar will be styled like a subheader of the page.

Header.!description: The bar will be styled like a header of the page.

Auto.!description: The Bar can be inserted into other controls and if the design is "Auto" then it inherits the design from parent control.

Footer.!description: The bar will be styled like a footer of the page.

sap.m.ComboBox.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ComboBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getSelectedItemId selectedItemId} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getShowSecondaryValues showSecondaryValues} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFilterSecondaryValues filterSecondaryValues} : boolean (default: false)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedItem selectedItem} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Item)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ComboBoxBase#constructor sap.m.ComboBoxBase} can be used as well.

getFilterSecondaryValues.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterSecondaryValues filterSecondaryValues}. Indicates whether the filter should check in both the text and the additionalText property of the {@link sap.ui.core.ListItem} for the suggestion. Default value is false.

getSelectedItem.!description: Gets the selected item object from the aggregation named items.

detachChange.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.m.ComboBox. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

getShowSecondaryValues.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowSecondaryValues showSecondaryValues}. Indicates whether the text values of the additionalText property of a {@link sap.ui.core.ListItem} are shown. Default value is false.

setShowSecondaryValues.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowSecondaryValues showSecondaryValues}. Indicates whether the text values of the additionalText property of a {@link sap.ui.core.ListItem} are shown. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bShowSecondaryValues: type: boolean, description: New value for property showSecondaryValues

sap.m.ComboBox.!description:
A drop-down list for selecting and filtering values.

Overview

The control represents a drop-down menu with a list of the available options and a text input field to narrow down the options.

Structure

The combo-box consists of the following elements:
  • Input field - displays the selected option or a custom user entry. Users can type to narrow down the list or enter their own value.
  • Drop-down arrow - expands\collapses the option list.
  • Option list - the list of available options.
By setting the showSecondaryValues property, the combo box can display an additional value for each option (if there is one). Filtering is done only on the first option.

Usage

When to use:

  • You need to select only one item in a long list of options (between 13 and 200) or your custom user input.

When not to use:

  • You need to select between only two options. Use a {@link sap.m.Switch switch} control instead.
  • You need to select between 12 options. Use a {@link sap.m.Select select} control instead.
  • You need to select between more than 200 options. Use a {@link sap.m.Input input} control with value help instead.

Responsive Behavior

  • The width of the option list adapts to its content. The minimum width is the input field plus the drop-down arrow.
  • There is no horizontal scrolling in the option list. Entries in the list that are too long will be truncated.
  • On phone devices the combo box option list opens a dialog.

getItems.!description: Gets aggregation items. Note: This is the default aggregation.

fireChange.!description: Fires event {@link #event:change change} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

attachSelectionChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} event of this sap.m.ComboBox. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.ComboBox itself. This event is fired when the user types something that matches with an item in the list; it is also fired when the user presses on a list item, or when navigating via keyboard.
attachSelectionChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.ComboBox

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.ComboBox itself

getSelectedItemId.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectedItemId selectedItemId}. ID of the selected item. Default value is empty string.

attachChange.!description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.m.ComboBox. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.ComboBox itself. This event is fired when the value in the text input field is changed in combination with one of the following actions:
  • The focus leaves the text input field
  • The Enter key is pressed
In addition, this event is also fired when an item in the list is selected.
attachChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.ComboBox

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.ComboBox itself

setFilterSecondaryValues.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFilterSecondaryValues filterSecondaryValues}. Indicates whether the filter should check in both the text and the additionalText property of the {@link sap.ui.core.ListItem} for the suggestion. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bFilterSecondaryValues: type: boolean, description: New value for property filterSecondaryValues

getSelectedKey.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey}. Key of the selected item. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used. Default value is empty string.

setSelectedItemId.!description: Sets the selectedItemId property. Default value is an empty string "" or undefined.

parameters.vItem: type: string|undefined, description: New value for property selectedItemId. If the provided vItem is an empty string "" or undefined, the selection is cleared. If the ID has no corresponding aggregated item, the selected item is not changed.
